edu.miracosta.cs113.printerQueue

Class Printer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.miracosta.cs113.printerQueue.Printer

  • public class Printer
extends java.lang.Object
    Printer : model class that represents printer that can be bounded by the number of pages the document has to have to be printed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Printer()
      Default constructor, creates a new Printer and increments ID counter.
      Printer(int lowerBound, int higherBound)
      Bounds constructor, creates a new Printer and increments ID counter, sets bounds

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addPrintJob(PrintJob pj)
      addPrintJob adds the printJob to the Queue if it is in bounds
      Printer clone()
      clone returns a copy of the printer with the same bounds
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      equals compares to the passed object to the Printer by bounds.
      PrintJob getCurrentJob()
      getCurrentJob returns current Job that is in the process of printing
      int getHigherBound()
      getLowerBound returns number of pages the print job should be smaller than to be printed
      int getLowerBound()
      getLowerBound returns number of pages the print job should be greater than to be printed
      boolean isEmpty()
      isEmpty checks if the queue of the printer is empty
      boolean isPrinting()
      isPrinting checks if the Printer is printing a job
      void print()
      prints 10 pages of the current document or the document next in the queue.
      void setBounds(int lowerBound, int higherBound)
      setBounds sets number of pages the document to be bounded by
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString creates a string describing Printer

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Printer

        public Printer()
        Default constructor, creates a new Printer and increments ID counter. Sets bounds to 0 which means printer can print any document.

      • Printer

        public Printer(int lowerBound,
               int higherBound)
        Bounds constructor, creates a new Printer and increments ID counter, sets bounds
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - integer represents lower bound of pages
        higherBound - integer represents upper bound of pages

    • Method Detail

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(int lowerBound,
                      int higherBound)
        setBounds sets number of pages the document to be bounded by
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - integer representing lower bound
        higherBound - integer representing upper bound

      • getLowerBound

        public int getLowerBound()
        getLowerBound returns number of pages the print job should be greater than to be printed
        Returns:
        integer representing number of pages

      • getHigherBound

        public int getHigherBound()
        getLowerBound returns number of pages the print job should be smaller than to be printed
        Returns:
        integer representing number of pages

      • addPrintJob

        public boolean addPrintJob(PrintJob pj)
        addPrintJob adds the printJob to the Queue if it is in bounds
        Parameters:
        pj - PrintJob passed
        Returns:
        boolean that is true if print job was added and false otherwise

      • print

        public void print()
        prints 10 pages of the current document or the document next in the queue. if queue is empty and no document is printing nothing happens.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString creates a string describing Printer
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representing Printer
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        isEmpty checks if the queue of the printer is empty
        Returns:
        boolean true if empty, false if there are print job(s) in the queue

      • isPrinting

        public boolean isPrinting()
        isPrinting checks if the Printer is printing a job
        Returns:
        boolean true if current job is not null, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        equals compares to the passed object to the Printer by bounds. IDs are not checked
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        boolean true if equal, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Object.equals(Object)

      • getCurrentJob

        public PrintJob getCurrentJob()
        getCurrentJob returns current Job that is in the process of printing
        Returns:
        PrintJob that is printing

      • clone

        public Printer clone()
        clone returns a copy of the printer with the same bounds
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        new Printer with the same bounds.
        See Also:
        Object.clone()
